p: The yield of CMEO was calculated from the dry weight of plant material employed for extraction of oil and it was found as 1.80%. The detailed chemical profile of CMEO was revealed by GC-MS analysis and a total of 46 compounds were identified constituting 95.27% ( Table 1 ). The major compounds were geraniol (19.06%), geranial (14.84%), geranyl propionate (12.88%), geranyl acetone (7.35%), geranyl acetate (4.81%), Î±-phellandrene (2.05%), and linalool (2.01%). The results were in according to the existed reports and however, quantity of the chemical constituents varied, and this could be due to the association of different aspects, such as climate ( Raina et al., 2003) part of the plant ( Rajeswara Rao et al., 2009; Smitha and Rana, 2015), harvesting season ( Kakaraparthi et al., 2015), nutrients ( Rao, 2001), stress ( Fatima et al., 1999), and extraction techniques of oil ( Cannon et al., 2013).
